sanskrit_verse:
यत्नेन भोजयेत्श्राद्धे बह्वृचं वेदपारगम् ।
शाखान्तगमथाध्वर्युं छन्दोगं तु समाप्तिकम् ॥ ३.१४५॥
transliteration:
yatnena bhojayet śrāddhe bahvṛcaṃ vedapāragam |
śākhāntagam athādhvaryuṃ chandoğaṃ tu samāptikam || 3.145||
sph_interpretive_translation: In Śrāddha rituals, one must honor with effort the Bahvṛca Veda-knower, the Adhvaryu who has mastered a Vedic branch, and the Saman-chanting priest who completes the liturgical sequence.

IF priestly invitation THEN verification of Vedic mastery MUST precede inclusion in ritual protocol
IF omission of qualified priest THEN corrective offering MUST follow to restore ancestral continuity
IF ritual completion THEN documentation of correct participation MUST occur for spiritual audit trail
